snippet: The number, the government said, was skewed by upgrades on two state computer systems that caused those states to underreport claims.
abstract: Labor Department reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits dropped 31,000 to seasonally adjusted 292,000, seemingly suggesting that economy is finally entering self-sustaining recovery; government says number is unreliable because of two state computer systems that caused those states to underreport claims.
lead_paragraph: The number, the government said, was skewed by upgrades on two state computer systems that caused those states to underreport claims.

headline.main: Labor Dept. Reports Plunge in Jobless Claims, Then Says Figures Were Flawed
headline.print_headline: Labor Dept. Reports Plunge in Jobless Claims, Then Says Figures Were Flawed
